passages.text: On Monday, at the Central Criminal Court, Mr. Henry William Pound, late managing director of a limited liability company, called Pound, Son, and Hutchings, now in liquidation, surrendered to take his trial for unlawfully obtaining timber of the value of th, of, by false pretences. The prosecutors in this case were Messrs. Brinsmead and Co. , ianoforte manusacturers and timber merchants. The company of which the defendant was the managing director was formed for the purpose of carrying on the huffness of timber merchants and packing case makers. At the close of last year they had entered into extenffve contracts with the Government for the supply of pack- ing cases and ammunition boxes to the War Of ece. Messrs. Brinsmead had supplicc conffderable quantie ties of timber to the company, and they were deffrious
'to have some additional security for payment. An

arrangement, it appeared, was then made, the terms of which were that whenever the company had sent in to the War Offece packing cases and boxes they should be supplied with timber to a corresponding amount by Brinsmead and Co. , ills being given by
e the company for the amount. The allegation on the t part of the prosecution was that from time to time
